author: Stacey Zafiroff
comment: Great to see my workouts I did on my treadmill! It's nice to see my progress, incline, times, courses and mileage completed.  However, I'd like to plan routes to run on my treadmill via the app. Why do I have to be logged in to a pc to do this? It's difficult to do on the treadmill, as well.  PC seems to be the only viable option. Overall,  great app. I like it! Also what is the ifit score? How is it computed and does it change based on length, speed or # of days worked out?
title: Great to see my workouts I did on my treadmill!

author: Connie Godfrey
comment: At first it worked OK. Now it won't upload any of my workouts (even of I try them individually). Also does not sync to any history workouts. When I logged out to try again, I lost all of my workouts in the upload queue (30+). Was hoping this would work and sync to my laptop and my iFit treadmill. Nope. Only place I seem to be successful is on the laptop. Lot of good that does me when I'm trying to be mobile and fit. My scheduled workouts do not show on the app. Using this app on my Android phone.
title: Records but does not upload workouts

author: Todd Thoune
comment: App worked great on Droid Maxx for first month, then the app would not upload any data to ifit. Tried reinstalling, tried sign in/out, no other noteworthy updates to the phone...can't get this to work with my ifit account since those first weeks.
title: Worked great, then Junk

author: Gage Herbst
comment: The app, as every other ifit product I've tried, is full of glitches. The concept is ok, but the glitches make it lag far behind the competition. It won't upload any of my workouts. There are way better free apps available.

author: Heather Nech
comment: I have a hard time keeping a workout schedule due to my very slbusy schedule that does not allow a lot of time. Days when I just don't have the juice I look at my fit score and get re-motivated.
title: Perfect to help keep me in line!

author: Ricardo Fonseca
comment: Juste une thing the characters are a little bit toi bog so not everything is readable. It would be good to be able to put the size smaller. Thank you
title: Very Nice app and working on m'y smartwatch3 without phone

author: Mike D
comment: I don't know what ifit changed, but like others here this app stopped uploading my workouts.  It still tracks them, but upload fails every time.  The workouts on my Nordic Track still upload,  but anything done outside does not.  The developer has not updated the program in over a year.  Very disappointing
title: Used to work fine, now it won't upload workouts

author: Quentin Moore
comment: I am working on a replacement for Runkeeper which works very poorly on my smartwatch 3. I haven't ran with ifit yet but I would like to see an option to manually start once GPS connects. Currently allows start now or auto.
title: Auto start on wear

author: Harvey Wilson
comment: It works very well. I used it with my Sony Smartwatch 3. I left my phone at home, turned on the watch's GPS and started a ride.I am very impressed with it overall. The GPS mapping is a bit all over the place in the map view on the app and online (phone is better). The only fault is that when showing the the Ride Display, I can't see everything on the watch. I also get constant messages about no internet even when I haven't done activity. Remove run at startup. It isn't needed.
title: Works well

author: Erin Becote
comment: Worked great until recently. It has stopped uploading my workouts. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling only to loose my last two workouts that wouldn't upload. >:( Please update and fix the app!
title: Too buggy

author: Kim Landwehr
comment: I use the app with my elliptical and it is inaccurate. It does not record the actual mileage I do. For example today I did a map route. That's what the machine said when I was finished. However the app read 2.79. An app that records an activity needs to be more accurate
title: Not Accurate

author: Robert Snapp
comment: It keeps detailed information and uploaded it to my iFit account,,,perfect for me, a number of times it would not upload a workout to the cloud. To solve this problem, I deleted the app, then reinstalled it. So there are bugs that need to be worked out. I use this app because my treadmill is also linked to iFit so the system keeps a running log of my workouts.
title: Meets my workout needs well

author: Glenn Hart
comment: One star only.....                                      This app really sux, I agree with all of the other users who have listed their negative reviews I have experienced to many problems with constant bugs and not being able to sync or upload to ifit. The wristband doesn't even sync or work reliably enough to record, better to search Google Play Store for alternative e apps that actually work and are for free to use. I hope that ifit get it right next time.

author: Pratya.W Content
comment: Will put up to 5 star if you guys can fix minor crashing when sync data back to my Samsung S6 Edge.
title: Great stand alone app for Smartwatch 3

author: Jason Fry
comment: It worked fine at first, then it wouldn't upload workouts I'd done. That seems to be fixed, but it still hangs up "downloading values."
title: Still has some bugs

author: Patrick Chavez
comment: Just start using this in the last couple of days.  Seems to track my bicycle rides well, but the font, as others have noted, is way too large!  Can only see time elapsed and average speed.  Also, the display on the watch is constantly lit, which is a real battery burner on these devices.  Why not a a simple timeout for the watch display? These seem to be a really simple thing to fix, so why the delay, and even more so how could the app go out this way?

author: Jennifer Carmichael
comment: This app used to be fantastic. Now my fitness score stays locked on 1, regardless of my workout.  Opening my history or my workout schedule causes the app to crash. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling it on my phone a couple times with minimal luck. One aspect of the app will start working, then all the rest goes bonkers. Maps aren't going through to my elliptical like they used to. Please fix iFit outside,  I miss it!
title: Save us from the bugs!

author: Bobby Pena
comment: ..... it updated and now it does not communicate with the website so it's useless.  Update: After working with the developer's at ifit for many months on this issue and others it still does not work.

reply.author: iFit
reply.content: Hey Bobby, I'm sorry to hear you had an issue with our app. The developers believe they have found and fixed your problem in the latest version. Please update and try again. If the problem persists, contact support@ifit.com so we can further investigate and find a solution to your problem.

title: Used to work great until....

author: Michael Allen
comment: This app has major problems, mainly IT DOES NOT WORK!!  It seemed to start to track my run on my Sony Smart Watch 3, but only displayed half the numbers.  As soon as I stopped to take a drink, it stopped tracking, I didn't touch it.  So it only timed half my run.  After my run, I tried up upload the half it tracked to see if that worked, and if couse, it did NOT.  DON'T PUT BUGGY GARBAGE APPS ON PLAYSTORE PLEASE!!!!!!!  YOU WASTED MY TIME AND A 3 MILE RUN TO TEST IT.
title: Garbage

author: Matthew Lucas
comment: It has the numbers so big in the new update that you can only see hours and minutes, no seconds.. plus there are lots of circles around the display it's hard to read and frustrating now.
title: The display is too large

author: Gareth Walker
comment: When installed a year ago. Great app. Worked and tracked perfectly. However last few months. WORST APP EVER. DOES NOT WORK. Everytime you open the app it crashes. Wont upload recent runs.
title: Useless

author: George Hurbanek
comment: This app needs an update; when I tried to upload my run, it won't allow me to. I also get kicked off the app when I try to view my schedule. Please fix because it used to be a good app.

author: Todd Suscovich
comment: They are no longer supporting this app anymore, so it will not upload ang data. Apparently, it will be integrated into the new if it coach app at a later date.

author: Donald Mathes
comment: This is the only way to bring workouts easily to your ifit machine. However, it only works half the time. When it's time to upload it just sits there and it only uploads half the data. I give up.
title: Works half the time

author: RICH S
comment: Used to work great but now it never uploads workouts. I'm removing from my phone until it's fixed
title: Useless don't waste your time

author: kaya Reed
comment: I had trouble at first because i didn't read how to operate it. Once i did have had no problems. Tracks well even maps out my route on gps accurately.
title: I fit act

author: Michael Shearer
comment: This is probably the worst, most useless, non-functional app I have EVER used. I had all settings correct, started my run and shortly after I realised it wasn't tracking any distance at all, only time. When I finished my 12km run and went to save it an error message saying run too short (or similar) popped up before wiping my time recording off. My recommendation is....DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME EVEN TRYING THIS APP. If I could rate it a '0' I would.

author: INTENZExRAINBOW
comment: No matter what I try, I cant get the app to track distance on my smartwatch. Im so fed up with this app.
title: Wont track my distance

author: Michael Lewis
comment: Have loved the app until it stopped uploading my work outs. Have tried all the trouble shooting and help. Now I have lost several months of running.
title: Wont upload work outs

author: Austin Reynolds
comment: I couldn't even get passed the birthday selection tool. It kept crashing. Sucks cause I bought a treadmill today and one if the biggest things I looked for was ifit compatibility.

author: Tyler Ivanco
comment: I've been using this for about 2 weeks on a Sony Smartwatch 3 (SW3).  It seems to eat up about 1%/min of the battery life compared to "My Tracks" which uses about 0.2%/min.  That is a bit high and means that a long hike event will require a recharge of the SW3. I did have issues with the upload to the ifit database for a while.  For the past 4 uses, it has worked perhaps by following the process of ... 1) Starting the IFIT app on the SW3 while in BT range of the host android device and choosing the type of activity, 2) Run,  Run,  Run,  3) Stop the activity on the SW3 IFIT app within BT range of the host.  I did not start any other SW3 app during the entire process including music etc.   I'm not sure that there was any magic in this process but so far so good.   However, I can't get the Polar HRM strap to connect/collect with this app however that could be an issue with the SW3 android wear OS.
title: Seems to hit the battery hard on Android Wear

author: C Eastwood
comment: Works OK but frequently get notification on watch that it had stopped, even when not in use.  Phone is Xperia z3 compact
title: Keeps crashing LG GwatchR

author: Carol Crawford
comment: Me and my husband purchased the IFIT LINK  last night at walmart. Yes like most we were very excited to get home and try it out. Sadly this thing is so complicated and doesn't even come with proper institutions you have to look em up online. On top of that we couldn't get ours to turn on and stay on they would turn right back off. And I couldn't get my phone to pick up the device on Bluetooth. Yes the reviews you read are true don't waste your money. My husband just left to go return them at the store.
title: Don't purchase the ifit link. Had to share

author: John Thayer
comment: Not very versatile and doesn't always update automatically. I haven't been successful at bringing my runs from other locations into my treadmill.
title: Useful but not fantastic

author: Amber Thompson
comment: It won't even let me login!   It kicks me out out stops working EVERY time at the spot where I try to put in my birthday! What a piece of crap!

author: Jeremey Rodriguez
comment: 1. Does not work unless you have a wearable. 2. GPS cannot track unless Bluetooth is on. 3. When using the wear app if you stop for any reason it ends your ride or run. 4. It pretends to do another ride when you restart, but it won't actually get logged. 5. Layout for Wear is only square watch face. No round, looks like garbage on Moto 360. 6. Bad wear UX. When I swipe to see the ride during the ride, don't ask if I want to open the app. Just open the app. 7. Can't see stats on phone if using wear app.
title: So many issues

author: Peter Jaegersen
comment: Crashes before opening other screens making it impossible to use. Stick with the good companies like strava or Garmin, this iFit company is a scam.

author: hosam zakariya
comment: It's not uploading my last run whatever I am trying, sent email to customer service, and no answer yet.  The application mostly showing me my running history on the treadmill, as I have ifit live.

author: Carlito Diego Gavin
comment: The app worked well initially but then stopped uploading the data to the phone rendering it useless... From reading other reviews it would appear that this issue happened to a number of other users but there appears to be no fix from the developer for this issue... therefore I had to mark this app down...
title: Very disappointing...

author: Pam Brock
comment: Error 920. I have the newest sumsung. If it isn't compatible then it's cr ap
title: Won't download
